author: Lalita Clozel
title: Seven States Team Up on Fintech Licenses
text:
WASHINGTON—Banking regulators from seven states are streamlining the way they license some financial-technology companies, responding to the companies’ complaints over having to obtain authorizations from each state in which they operate.
The states participating in the program, which went into effect Tuesday, are Georgia, Illinois, Kansas, Massachusetts, Tennessee, Texas and Washington state.
